article_title: Nurses Shift, Aiming for More Time With Patients
article_text:
Hospitals are freeing up nurses to do the one thing they often don't have enough time for: taking care of patients.

Swamped with tasks such as hunting for supplies, tracking down medications, filling out paperwork at the nursing station and looking for missing test results, nurses may spend less than two hours of a 12-hour shift in direct patient care, studies show. But research has also found that the more time nurses spend at the...

twitter.description: Hospitals hope extra face time and personal attention in the patient's room will help make recovery easier.
twitter.title: Nurses Shift, Aiming for More Time With Patients

image.alt: See the Charlotte hospital trying to put nurses with patients 8.5 hours per 12-hour shift
